Jyotiraditya Scindia on Musk's Starlink licence: Approval after security complianceTesla CEO Elon Musk, the world's richest man, has been eyeing entry to the Indian telecom sector with Starlink.

Sensex tumbles over 800 points. Here's how much money investors lostAnalysts attributed the selloff to continued foreign investor outflows and disappointing quarterly earnings, particularly in banking and auto sectors. Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) reportedly offloaded Rs 2,306 crore worth of Indian equities, extending their selling spree.

Swiggy IPO listing: Around 500 employees likely to become crorepatisSwiggy's IPO stock market listing: The grey market premium (GMP) of Rs 2 ahead of Wednesday's debut indicates only a marginal gain of 0.51% above the issue price.
Retail inflation at a 14-month high, rises to 6.21% in OctoberThe inflation rate currently stands at 6.68% in rural areas, surpassing the urban inflation rate, which is recorded at 5.62%.

Sensex tanks 820 points, Nifty tumbles: 4 factors behind stock market bloodbathAfter opening in green, the S&P BSE Sensex reversed course, dragged down by banking, financial services, and auto stocks. The Nifty50, too, faced a broad-based decline, with nearly all sectoral indices closing in the red except for Nifty Realty.

Zinka Logistics Solutions IPO: 10 things to know before subscribingZinka Logistics Solution Limited, established in April 2015, operates a digital platform called the BlackBuck app tailored for truck operators.

Swiggy IPO listing: What does latest GMP indicate ahead of market debut? Bengaluru-based Swiggy opened for subscription with a price band of Rs 371 to Rs 390, aiming to raise Rs 11,327 crore through the Initial Public Offering (IPO).

They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Kfin Technologies Limited, the registrar for the issue.

Bitcoin price nears $90,000. What's behind the rally and will it continue? The recent rally in Bitcoin, now nearing $90,000, comes on the back of Donald Trump's pro-crypto stance following his recent election victory in the US.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Executive can't become judge: Supreme Court warning on bulldozer actionThe top court emphasised that the executive cannot assume the role of adjudication, stating that the arbitrary demolition of a citizen's home on mere accusations violates constitutional law and the principle of separation of powers.

15-day notice, video recording: Supreme Court frames guidelines for demolitionsThe Supreme Court issued guidelines for demolitions in cases of illegal construction and encroachments, mandating a 15-day advance notice, video recording, and public display of reports and warning officials of prosecution for non-compliance.

Elon Musk, Vivek Ramaswamy to lead DOGE to clean up bureaucracy: TrumpIn a statement, Trump said Musk and Ramaswamy "will pave the way for my administration to dismantle government bureaucracy, slash excess regulations, cut wasteful expenditures, and restructure federal agencies".

Delhi gas chamber: Thick smog diverts flights, air quality drops to 'very poor'AQI in Delhi: Aya nagar, Anand Vihar and Delhi University's North Campus recorded the worst air quality in the city with air quality crossing over 400 on Wednesday, which falls under the severe category, according to the data by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

Live: Champai Soren confident of BJP forming next government in Jharkhand Jharkhand Election 2024 Phase 1 Live Updates: Voting for the first phase of the Jharkhand Assembly elections, covering 43 out of 81 constituencies, began at 7 am today. As many as 683 candidates are in the fray for legislative seats, which include 17 general, 20 reserved for Scheduled Tribes, and six reserved for Scheduled Castes. In the 2019 Jharkhand Assembly election, Hemant Soren-led JMM won 30 seats, the BJP won 25 and Congress won 16 seats.

Indians dream of life in US, but why are Americans fleeing the country?Indians even use the risky Donkey Route for a life in the US. However, Americans are choosing a life outside the US, according to reports and online discussions. AmerExit became a hot topic after Donald Trump's victory. Who are these Americans fleeing the US, and why are they doing so?

Devendra Fadnavis's bag was checked too: BJP rebuts Uddhav Thackeray with videoThe BJP shared a video on X, showing Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis's bags being checked. This comes after a row over two bag checks of Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray, once in Yavatmal and another time in Latur.

Elon Musk's rise: How billionaire rocketed from startup founder to US politicsAt the age of 53, Elon Musk is not only the CEO of a host of groundbreaking ventures like Tesla and SpaceX, but has emerged as a significant political force in the incoming Donald Trump administration.

How risky can your partner's kiss really be?If your partner's kiss leaves your skin red and itchy, you're likely dealing with beard burn. While it can be uncomfortable and even lead to infections, the good news is that it's usually easy to treat and manage.

Vivek Ramaswamy: The Indian-American who dropped presidential bid to back TrumpVivek Ramaswamy, a 38-year-old born in Ohio to immigrant parents from India, ended his White House bid in January this year and endorsed Donald Trump for President.

Can Champai Soren, once a Hemant Soren's fill-in, defend his stronghold for BJP?Champai Soren, who is the BJP candidate for Sareikela Assembly elections, has won the constituency since the first Assembly elections in Jharkhand in 2005.

Who is John Ratcliffe, former US spy tapped by Trump as CIA director?On his social media platform, Truth Social, Trump described John Ratcliffe as a "warrior for truth and honesty with the American public."  Ratcliffe was also declared as the nation's top spy in May 2020, eight months before Trump left office.

Yash's Toxic in trouble: Case against makers for cutting trees during shootYash's Toxic in trouble: An FIR has been lodged against the makers of Toxic, starring Yash, for the illegal felling of trees on forest land. The actor is currently shooting for the film in Mumbai.

Schools shut in few Tamil Nadu districts due to heavy rain, more showers likelyThe India Meteorological Department warns of heavy rainfall across coastal regions of Tamil Nadu, with a yellow alert in place for the week. Heavy rainfall is predicted through the week across several districts.

What is AQI? Understanding India's air quality and how to check itAs pollution levels rise across Indian cities, understanding and tracking AQI has become vital for health and safety. Here's a guide to checking your area's AQI and what these levels mean.

Auto driver hacks woman to death in revenge for hitting him with slippersA 52-year-old autorickshaw driver killed a 50-year-old woman over a grudge. Reportedly the woman, a vegetable seller, had hit him with slippers during an argument 10 days ago.

Kanguva gets 9 am shows in Tamil Nadu, 4 am shows in Andhra Pradesh, KeralaThe Tamil Nadu government has granted permission for five daily shows of Suriya's Kanguva. In other South Indian states, the film will have early morning screenings, starting as early as 4 am.

Kanguva advance booking: Suriya's film earns over Rs 4 crore ahead of releaseKanguva has earned Rs 4.3 crore in advance bookings. Set to release on November 14, the film stars Suriya and Bobby Deol. It is releasing in 8 languages across 10,000 screens.

Hrithik Roshan shares special memory as he gives voiceover for Karan Arjun trailerHrithik Roshan shared a cherished memory of his father Rakesh Roshan's film Karan Arjun. The iconic movie, set for a theatrical re-release, surprised fans with a new trailer.

Mumbai beat Bengal to successfully defend Senior Women's T20 Trophy title Humaira Kaazi's Mumbai defeated Bengal by 10 wickets at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai to successfully defend their title in the Senior Women's T20 Trophy.

Mohammed Shami back with 'same passion and energy': 360 days is a long timeIndia pacer Mohammed Shami is set to be back in action after nearly a year's hiatus. The pacer took to social media and said that he is returning back with same energy and passion.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.
